summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between attorneys and a U.S. Attorney's office regarding scheduling interviews for two clients who allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in 2004. It discusses travel arrangements, meeting logistics, and the availability of victim services.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney communicating with the U.S. Attorney's office to schedule interviews for two clients who believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein. She coordinates travel and meeting details.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: CC'd on emails to help coordinate travel arrangements for a witness/client for an interview with the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: Identified as the New York attorney who will accompany a client (Ms. [redacted]) to her interview with the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: CC'd on initial emails from Teri Gibbs regarding the victim reports against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). Two clients allege they were assaulted by him in or around June 2004.

connections.description: Teri Gibbs identifies Arick Fudali as the New York attorney who will accompany their client to an interview, indicating a professional legal collaboration.
Teri Gibbs copies Colleen Mullen on emails to coordinate witness travel logistics for an interview with the U.S. Attorney's office.
Teri Gibbs represents clients who are alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein, placing her in an adversarial legal relationship with him.

events.title: Alleged Assaults by Epstein
events.description: Two clients of attorney Teri Gibbs believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Scheduled Interview with Victim
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for 12 p.m. (later adjusted to 10:30 a.m.) at the U.S. Attorney's office with one alleged victim, accompanied by attorney Arick Fudali.

events.title: Scheduled Video Conference with Victim
events.description: A video conference (via Skype) is scheduled for 5 p.m. EST with a second alleged victim who is located in Japan.

locations: New York, NY 10007 (One Saint Andrew's Plaza, Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
Okinawa (mentioned in context of time zone for victim in Japan)
keyFacts: Two new alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein are identified, with assaults claimed to have occurred around June 2004.
The victims' attorneys provided photographs from 2004 to the U.S. Attorney's office and requested confirmation if their clients appeared in photos seized from Epstein's home.
The U.S. Attorney's office offered victim services, including counseling via an FBI victim specialist, to the attorney's clients.
Extensive coordination for interviews took place in August 2019, involving in-person and international video conference meetings.
The email chain is part of case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), indicating ongoing federal prosecution activity prior to Epstein's death.
